item.description:
What could be better than staying close to home and seeing a Metropolitan Opera production in the cinema? (perhaps seeing it live in NYC...)

Fathom Events shows operas, anime, radio shows and more in movie theaters across the country. Bizet's "Carmen" will be playing on July 28. Tickets are selling out quickly in Boston, so let's see it in Dedham. If you want to attend, purchase your ticket SOON so you don't miss out.


from : http://www.fathomeven...

Elina Garanca and Roberto Alagna caused a sensation with their smoldering performances in the Met’s acclaimed new production of Bizet’s masterpiece. One of the most popular operas of all time, Carmen “is about sex, violence, and racism—and its corollary: freedom,” says Olivier Award-winning director Richard Eyre. Barbara Frittoli plays Micaëla, Teddy Tahu Rhodes is the matador Escamillo, and Yannick Nézet-Séguin conducts in his widely praised Met debut.



****Meet in the lobby of the Showcase Cinema at Legacy Place at 5:45. We will get in line to go into the theater at 6:00
**General Admission: $12.50 (plus $1 service fee if ordering online)
**Purchase tickets at the box office or order tickets online (recommended):


To order online: https://www.movietick...

*** Please update your "Yes" RSVP after you've purchased your ticket
item.how_to_find_us: I will be in the theater lobby around 5:30 p.m. and will be holding a Meetup sign. I will also provide my cell # the day of the event.
item.name: Carmen: Cinema Style
